title: Less Excuses More Solutions (you can worm farm anywhere sis!)

tasks.task: Inspect the 10 IL San hives for any issues or treatment needs.
subtasks: Approach the hives slowly and cautiously.
Look for any signs of disease or pests in the hives.
Check the health of the bees, such as their behavior and demeanor.
Examine the brood frames for any abnormalities or excessive disease.
Assess the queen's presence and activity inside the hive.
Perform any necessary treatments or interventions for the hive's health.

tasks.task: Add or remove frames from the 10 IL San hives as needed.
subtasks: Determine the appropriate number of frames based on current hive activity.
Carefully lift and manipulate frames to add or remove them from the hive.
Ensure that frames are properly spaced and not too crowded for the bees.
Secure any added frames to maintain hive structure.

tasks.task: Check the bees for any signs of disease, pests, or other issues.
subtasks: Examine individual bees for visible signs of pests or disease.
Inspect bee behavior for any anomalies, such as excessive swarming or aggression.
Look for any deformed wings, legs, or other physical abnormalities.
Note any signs of honeybee parasites or diseases, such as varroa mites or nosema.

tasks.task: Harvest a portion of the honeycomb.
subtasks: Identify the appropriate frames containing ripe honeycomb.
Carefully extract the honeycomb from the frames, being cautious not to damage it.
Place the harvested honeycomb in a suitable container or storage area.

tasks.task: Transfer some of the honeycomb to another location.
subtasks: Move the harvested honeycomb carefully to avoid dripping or spilling honey.
Position the honeycomb in the designated storage or processing area.
Ensure that the transferred honeycomb is properly labeled or marked.
Identify areas within the hive where propolis is present, such as seams or openings.
Gently scrape or remove the propolis using appropriate tools.
Collect the propolis in a clean container for future use.

tasks.task: Clean and maintain the 10 IL San hives.
subtasks: Remove any debris, dead bees, or other foreign material from the hives.
Inspect and repair any structural damage to the hive boxes or components.
Ensure that the hive ventilation and moisture levels are appropriate.
Apply any necessary treatments or preventative measures to maintain hive health.
Inspect the hives for excess moisture, such as from rain or dampness.
Adjust ventilation as needed to prevent mold or mildew growth.
Ensure proper drainage around the hives to avoid water accumulation.
Determine the appropriate treatments based on pest or disease presence.
Mix and apply treatments as per label instructions, ensuring safety.
Document all treatments applied and note any observations or issues.
